    • board.Board

extends java.lang.Object

      Board()
      Instantiates Board object filling it with chess pieces.

      • getwPieces

        public java.util.ArrayList<Piece> getwPieces()
        Returns:
        the ArrayList containing all white pieces still in the game.

      • setwPieces

        public void setwPieces(java.util.ArrayList<Piece> wPieces)
        Sets the ArrayList of white pieces.
        Parameters:
        wPieces - - The new ArrayList of white pieces.

      • getbPieces

        public java.util.ArrayList<Piece> getbPieces()
        Returns:
        the ArrayList containing all black pieces still in the game.

        public void setbPieces(java.util.ArrayList<Piece> bPieces)
        Sets the ArrayList of black pieces.
        Parameters:
        bPieces - - The new ArrayList of black pieces.

      • getPawns

        public java.util.ArrayList<Pawn> getPawns()
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of all existing pawns in the game.

      • setPawns

        public void setPawns(java.util.ArrayList<Pawn> pawns)
        Sets the ArrayList of all pawns.
        Parameters:
        pawns - - The new ArrayList of pawns.

      • get

        public Piece get(board.FileRank fr)
        Gets the chess piece at the given FileRank location
        Parameters:
        fr - - The given FileRank
        Returns:
        The piece located at the given FileRank

      • set

        public void set(board.FileRank fr,
                Piece piece)
        Puts the parameterized Piece on the given FileRank. If the piece is null, it empties the FileRank space.
        Parameters:
        fr - - The FileRank being changed
        piece - - The piece being put on the space

      • put

        public void put(board.FileRank start,
                board.FileRank end)
        Places the piece at FileRank start on FileRank end, regardless of the legality of the move. Useful for placing the rook when the king is castling.
        Parameters:
        start - - The FileRank where the piece is first located.
        end - - The FileRank of the destination of the piece.

      • move

        public boolean move(board.FileRank start,
                    board.FileRank end)
        Moves the piece from start to the end, capturing the piece at FileRank end, but only if the move is valid.
        Parameters:
        start - - The FileRank where the piece starts.
        end - - The FileRank where the piece will end at, if the move is valid.
        Returns:
        true if the move is valid, false if otherwise.

      • underAttack

        public boolean underAttack(board.FileRank fr,
                           char team)
        Detects whether a FileRank is under attack, which means an enemy piece could reach it and capture a piece if it were occupied.
        Parameters:
        fr - - The given FileRank
        team - - The character representing the team that would be under attack ('b' if black, 'w' if white)
        Returns:
        Returns true if any piece from the team opposing the parameterized team could capture a piece on the parameterized team if it were on the given FileRank. False if otherwise.

      • inCheck

        public boolean inCheck(char team)
        Detects if the parameterized team in chess is in check by testing if their king is vulnerable.
        Parameters:
        team - - ('b' if black, 'w' if white) The team that is being tested for being in check
        Returns:
        true if the parameterized team is in check, false if not.

      • checkForCM

        public boolean checkForCM(char team)
        This method detects whether or not the given team is in checkmate.
        Parameters:
        team - - ('b' if black, 'w' if white)
        Returns:
        true if the parameterized team is in checkmate, false if there exists a move where their king is not in check.

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Prints the chessboard in the required format
